summary: To get more federal funds to areas with long-term poverty, some federal agencies have to follow the "10-20-30 formula"—use at least 10% of certain grant, loan, and other program funds in counties with poverty rates of at least 20% over the last 30 years. However, agencies have identified these "persistent-poverty counties" in different ways, and some agencies are required to use outdated poverty data. As...
title: Areas with High Poverty: Changing How the 10-20-30 Funding Formula Is Applied Could Increase Impact in Persistent-Poverty Counties
